2. New joiner get familiar with community tools: jira, gerrit, slack
Mainly, jira is for task assignment. Everyone can create new task item there.
New created item is with “todo” status, and other people can assign it to himself.
After assignment, he should update the task to “in-processing” status, and give an estimated time.
We use gerrit for code repo: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org>. On the README.md there is steps on how to use it.
Slack channel is where we discuss, i guess there is some robot support.

attachments.title: Old and New Python Versions : Felix Krull
attachments.text: This PPA has older and newer Python versions for Ubuntu. The packages in the official archives generally don't go back all that far, but people might still need to develop and test against these old Python interpreters. There also was a time when Google App Engine still ran on Python 2.5, but nobody likes to talk about that.A disclaimer first: I do not guarantee any kind of updates. In particular, I shed all responsibility for security issues in these packages. If you want to use them in a ...

I'm seeing an error when running tox. I've gone through the different contributor steps and this is the error that I receive when performing `make check`:
```
$ make check
run python tox pylint
# set -o pipefail
rm -rf .tox/pylint/log
# bin_path=.tox/pylint/bin
# export PYTHON=in_path/python
tox -v -epylint
using tox.ini: /home/latitia/work/fabric-sdk-py/tox.ini
ERROR: unknown environment 'pylint'
make: *** [pylint] Error 1
```
I found the following issue for tox that seems related to this issue: <https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/tox/issues/280/having-interpreters-that-arent-installed>

attachments.title: Having interpreters that aren't installed in envlist causes tox to refuse to run
attachments.text: I have a tox.ini that looks like this. ``` [tox] # envlist = py27, py33, py34, py35, pypy, jython, pylint envlist = py27, py33, py34 skip_missing_interpreters = true [testenv] deps = py27,pypy,jython: funcsigs lazy-object-proxy py27,py33,pypy,jython: singledispatch six wrapt pylint: hg+<https://bitbucket.org/logilab/pylint> commands = python -m unittest discover -s {envsitepackagesdir}/astroid/tests -p "unittest*.py" ``` As I understand it, this should run with any missing interpreters skipped. Instead, running `tox` with CPython 2.7 and 3.4 installed, but not 3.3, gives: ``` ERROR: InterpreterNotFound: python3.3 ERROR: unknown environment 'py27' ``` Different combinations of missing interpreters can give different InterpreterNotFound and unknown environment errors, and it's not deterministic which will be reported. Commenting out the `commands = ` line causes it to run with: ``` py27: commands succeeded SKIPPED: py33: InterpreterNotFound: python3.3 py34: commands succeeded congratulations :) ``` As I'd expect, but of course this then doesn't run the tests. `tox -e` using py27 or py34 will run, `tox -e py33` gives the same error as `tox`. This is on Ubuntu Linux. I've tried both version 1.8.0, the version packaged by Ubuntu, and version 2.1.1 installed with pip, and they exhibit the same behavior.
attachments.fallback: Having interpreters that aren't installed in envlist causes tox to refuse to run

Sorry for the wide blast here, but while I was reviewing stuff, thought I should send out a note on things which will make life easier for the maintainers and will help contributions be merged more quickly:

1) Please make sure to reference a JIRA item in your commits - especially for new functionality

2) Let's try to add a little more detail to some of the JIRA entries - one line entries / descriptions don't help us understand what contribution is trying to achieve

3) When people make comments in gerrit, once you address them please mark them as done (by clicking in the comment and hitting done  :slightly_smiling_face:  )

4) You'll notice that we push back a lot on lack of tests - please test locally and use a coverage tool to see where you stand

5) Run linters, go import, etc to reduce CI failures
From garisingh, i cannot agree more, this is really important to follow efficient rules from the beginning.

who will attend today’s meeting, pls hands up!

OK, we got seveveral attendees, let’s see the agenda
Any one has problem with the assigned work?
I saw the most items have owners already.

in previous days, the proto is not that stable, now most proto files api are fixed.
So let’s start the implementation work right now. I would encourage we create each issue small and focused enough.
We got numerous patchset in last week, good progress!
I will encourage other people make your name there :slightly_smiling_face:
We welcome all types of contribution, including code patch, script, and doc.
There’s no limit how large a patchset has to be, we prefer a smaller and focused one, easy to review and decide to merge. That’s the secret :slightly_smiling_face:
We plan to implement a mvp with support chaincode deployment/invoke/query.
could u be more specific about the mvp? :wink:
yeap, we currently have a minimum running fabric env with 1 peer+1 order+1 cop.
the mvp should let people deploy/invoke/query chaincode of example02.

latitia, guess u add this item?

the bdd for fabric code, right?
esp. for the deploy/invoke/query functionality for the chaincode
and the broadcast and deliver for the orderer
Yes, that is correct. this is bdd for fabric
yeap, we definitely would like to support that!
And before it, we need a mvp :yum:
Let’s try to finish the mvp before next week’s end (Chinese new year holiday start)

no problem. I have to work on some of the framework for the test team and then, I should be able to join in to get us to mvp with <@U1B7735PA>
OK. i will also offer that help, considering it’s the top-1 priority now!
Any one have issue to propose?

OK, that'all for the meeting, thanks everyone, have a nice day, and enjoy a wonderful new year holidays!
See you in new year and let's work together offline :slightly_smiling_face:
